com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.syntaxAnalyzer.ast.types

Class RootSyntaxAST

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.syntaxAnalyzer.ast.AbstractSyntaxAST
      • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.syntaxAnalyzer.ast.types.RootSyntaxAST

  • public class RootSyntaxAST
extends AbstractSyntaxAST
    Used if you want to create a new RootSyntaxAST. It doesn't has an AbstractParser because you shouldn't treat this class like that. There should only be one instance for one ArkoiClass.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RootSyntaxAST

        public RootSyntaxAST(SyntaxAnalyzer syntaxAnalyzer)
        Constructs a new RootSyntaxAST with the given parameters. The SyntaxAnalyzer is used to check syntax and also to get the ArkoiClass or ArkoiCompiler.
        Parameters:
        syntaxAnalyzer - the SyntaxAnalyzer is part for the most code used by AbstractSyntaxAST's.

    • Method Detail

      • parseAST

        public RootSyntaxAST parseAST(AbstractSyntaxAST parentAST,
                              SyntaxAnalyzer syntaxAnalyzer)
        Parses a new TypeSyntaxAST with the given parameters, where the SyntaxAnalyzer is used to check the syntax and the parent AbstractSyntaxAST is used to see if this AST can be created inside the parent. It will parse every ImportDefinitionSyntaxAST, VariableDefinitionSyntaxAST and FunctionDefinitionSyntaxAST which are present at the root-level (the first layer of the AST). Besides that it will parse also AnnotationSyntaxAST's but they return a followed FunctionDefinitionSyntaxAST or VariableDefinitionSyntaxAST. So basically just these three types of ASTs are getting parsed.
        Specified by:
        parseAST in class AbstractSyntaxAST
        Parameters:
        parentAST - the parent AbstractSyntaxAST which should get used to check if the AbstractSyntaxAST can be created inside it.
        syntaxAnalyzer - the SyntaxAnalyzer which is used for checking the syntax with methods like SyntaxAnalyzer.matchesCurrentToken(TokenType) )} or SyntaxAnalyzer.matchesNextToken(AbstractNumberToken.NumberType).
        Returns:
        null if an error occurred or the RootSyntaxAST if everything worked correctly.
